top_categories.workout_context: 200 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Unbound Gravel 200's Flint Hills gravel, rolling hills forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 200 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Unbound Gravel 200's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 200 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
200 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
11,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Unbound Gravel 200, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on rolling gravel with punchy climbs. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
55ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 11,000ft of climbing on rolling gravel with punchy climbs does to your power file on race day.
At Unbound Gravel 200, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
11,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.heat: June in Emporia, Kansas — June brings 85-95°F days with high humidity. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Unbound Gravel 200 — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Heat adaptation critical; Hydration demands extreme.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 200 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 200 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Unbound Gravel 200 demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride rolling gravel with punchy climbs at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: flint hills gravel, rolling hills, sharp limestone. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 200 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 200 miles of rolling gravel with punchy climbs in Emporia, Kansas.
